title: The Chinese donation consisted of general medical supplies to help fight COVID-19
subtitle: A post shared on Facebook and WhatsApp claims that China has sent COVID-19 vaccines to Burundi. The claim is false; China did donate medical supplies to the eastern African nation, but not vaccines, which do not exist yet for the disease.
author: factual.afp.com
vclaim: The same claim has also been shared on WhatsApp alongside a voice clip in Luganda, a language widely spoken in Uganda. It warns Ugandans that a Chinese COVID-19 vaccine designed to kill Africans has arrived in Burundi and will soon be used on them.
